bill_title: revise certain provisions regarding the directional sign program for certain business establishments located near an interstate or primary highway.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the directional sign program for certain business establishments located near an interstate or primary highway. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 31-29 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a business offering gasoline services qualifies to have a business sign pursuant to § 31-29- 80.1 and if that business offers E85 as defined by § 10-47B-3, the transportation commission shall provide that any such business sign for the business also indicate that the business has E85 services. The commission shall also provide that any such business sign is not subject to any fee or assessment pursuant to § 31-29-80.2. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.04 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions regarding the directional sign program for certain business establishments located near an interstate or primary highway. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 31-29 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: If a business offering gasoline services qualifies to have a business sign pursuant to § 31-29- 80.1 and if that business offers E85 as defined by § 10-47B-3, the transportation commission shall provide that any such business sign for the business also indicate that the business has E85 services. No such indication of E85 services on a business sign may be subject to any additional fee or assessment pursuant to § 31-29-80.2. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.04 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
